fxInfo_citation: Pemstein et al. (2018, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2018:21); V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
fxInfo_clarification: Leave this question blank if election was nonpartisan, i.e., no parties (not even pro-government parties) were allowed.
fxInfo_cross_coder_aggregation: Bayesian Item Response Theory Measurement Model
fxInfo_question: Does a single party control important policymaking bodies across subnational units(regional and local governments)?

fxInfo_responses.value: In almost all subnational units (at least 90%), a single party controls all or virtually all policymaking bodies.
In most subnational units (66%-90%), a single party controls all or virtually all policymaking bodies.
In few subnational units (less than 66%), a single party controls all or virtually all policymaking bodies.

fxInfo_scale: Ordinal, converted to interval by the measurement model
name: v2pssunpar, *_osp, *_ord
